roleset.name: suggest

example.name: implied clause
example.text: The statistics imply that three - quarters of blacks approve of Mr. Bush 's job performance and 85 % of blacks approve of Mrs. Bush .

propbank.arg: that three - quarters of blacks approve of Mr. Bush 's job performance and 85 % of blacks approve of Mrs. Bush

example.name: implied NP
example.text: A reintegrated Europe implies big changes in 40 - year - old military and economic policies .

propbank.arg: big changes in 40 - year - old military and economic policies

example.name: discourse usage
example.text: As their name implies , these operations are linked to far - reaching policy reforms that aim at helping borrowing countries get back on the growth path and at enhancing their credit - worthiness .

propbank.arg: these operations are linked to far - reaching policy reforms that aim at helping borrowing countries get back on the growth path and at enhancing their credit - worthiness

example.name: ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: Domestic brand , eh , actually is just what the name implies , eh , this , it 's our own baby .

roleset.note: IMPLY-V NOTES: Effectively this should be read as "their name implies that these operations...", but Treebank uniformly does not parse it this way, probably because of the "as". Hence the need for the non-constituent argument. (from imply.01-v)
